text:
After importing the example-content in the default pub using Tomcat, the content
directory contains the authoring folder (as it should), but at the same level
are duplicates of all of the uuid folders that reside inside of authoring.

So..

content/
        authoring/
                  a97bf050-b0b6-11db-90ea-9bd13ea5086a/
                  a8768e40-b0b6-11db-90ea-9bd13ea5086a/
                  ...
        a97bf050-b0b6-11db-90ea-9bd13ea5086a/
        a8768e40-b0b6-11db-90ea-9bd13ea5086a/
        ...

These extra top-level folders contain duplicate .rcml files.

This does not occur when using Jetty.

I'm using Java 1.4 and WinXp.
creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com
jonathan.addison@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 19487
screenshot of default pub content directory
The same happens when you delete a document, also in Jetty.
creator: andreas@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text: Maybe it's a problem of SourceWrapper.computeRealSourceUri().
